body:
Don't join a denomination. There are to be no divisions among us. Get out of the political trap while you still can. False siblings and televangelist pharisees are all over the place on a mission to spy on the freedom we have in the Anointed One. They want to exhort people in the name of religion and gain power and money. In New Testament times Christians met in house churches, hiding underground from the Romans and the Jewish fundamentalists who burned them alive on the streets if they found them. The churches were not churches, they were meetings and a spiritual body. It was not "everyone sit down and listen to the pastor" like in pagan temples. The church is the body of believers, the assembly, which transcends all worldly divisions. Not a denomination, not a pope, not a political platform, not any secular authority.

Do not think you will be saved by sacraments or prayers. God already knows what you would pray for. And you must be immersed with the holy spirit and fire, not water. Salvation is by faith. Anyone who calls on the name of ê§âê§Ñê§Öê§Ñ will be saved.

body: Paul is unlikely to have encountered such sects during his lifetime. While there are letters of "Paul" which denounce Marcionism (Timothy and Titus), they are very obviously written by 2nd century church fathers specifically to combat it. While Paul would certainly have rebuked it himself, he was not a reactionary who just said everything the opposite of Marcion or whoever "the enemy" was at the time. Paul disagrees with Marcion, but also agrees with him in important ways which the church fathers sought to obscure.

body: Technically anything that emphasizes faith apart from the religious institution and human authority is "Gnosticism", meaning most of the bible authors, including Jesus, are undoubtedly gnostic, and almost every Christian outside of catholic/orthodox denominations is gnostic at least partially. However usually believers use the word gnostic much more narrowly, to refer to someone who denies the resurrection and most of the miracles and atonement, and believes in paganism and other very strange things.

post.body: I'm curious about some of you think of this story. Personally I think it's fake, as it's only referenced at the beginning of Matthew and Luke, the latter clearly being a later addition to the original Luke. Nowhere else do any of the writers show any indication of knowing about a virgin birth, including in the rest of Matthew and Luke. Additionally, some of the oldest manuscripts of Matthew read "Joseph begat Jesus" and many current references to Joseph are "Jesus's father" in the oldest manuscripts. The genealogy in Matthew makes no sense if Mary conceived as a virgin, as it shows Joseph's line of descent, not Mary's, and the whole point is to show how Jesus came from the Davidic line. I have a theory however about why this story was added: the faithless church fathers, instead of believing because it is self-evident, either newly interpreted Isaiah 7:14 as messianic, or it was actually put there by Matthew, but the church fathers, due to a mistranslation in the LXX, thought it meant virgin when it was actually young woman (the same word is used for both). Either way, they lacked faith and only cared about creating a religious system to control people, and authored this story to "prove" it right. Ironically, the original Hebrew prophecy is only correct if Joseph is Jesus's (biological) father. It's also possible that they wanted to introduce elements of pagan legends, though harmless ones in this case (unless you take it to the extreme of worshiping Mary).

Personally I think it's fake, as it's only referenced at the beginning of Matthew and Luke, the latter clearly being a later addition to the original Luke. Nowhere else do any of the writers show any indication of knowing about a virgin birth, including in the rest of Matthew and Luke. Additionally, some of the oldest manuscripts of Matthew read "Joseph begat Jesus" and many current references to Joseph are "Jesus's father" in the oldest manuscripts. The genealogy in Matthew makes no sense if Mary conceived as a virgin, as it shows Joseph's line of descent, not Mary's, and the whole point is to show how Jesus came from the Davidic line. I have a theory however about why this story was added: the faithless church fathers, instead of believing because it is self-evident, either newly interpreted Isaiah 7:14 as messianic, or it was actually put there by Matthew, but the church fathers, due to a mistranslation in the LXX, thought it meant virgin when it was actually young woman (the same word is used for both). Either way, they lacked faith and only cared about creating a religious system to control people, and authored this story to "prove" it right. Ironically, the original Hebrew prophecy is only correct if Joseph is Jesus's (biological) father. It's also possible that they wanted to introduce elements of pagan legends, though harmless ones in this case (unless you take it to the extreme of worshiping Mary).

Nowhere else do any of the writers show any indication of knowing about a virgin birth, including in the rest of Matthew and Luke. Additionally, some of the oldest manuscripts of Matthew read "Joseph begat Jesus" and many current references to Joseph are "Jesus's father" in the oldest manuscripts. The genealogy in Matthew makes no sense if Mary conceived as a virgin, as it shows Joseph's line of descent, not Mary's, and the whole point is to show how Jesus came from the Davidic line. I have a theory however about why this story was added: the faithless church fathers, instead of believing because it is self-evident, either newly interpreted Isaiah 7:14 as messianic, or it was actually put there by Matthew, but the church fathers, due to a mistranslation in the LXX, thought it meant virgin when it was actually young woman (the same word is used for both). Either way, they lacked faith and only cared about creating a religious system to control people, and authored this story to "prove" it right. Ironically, the original Hebrew prophecy is only correct if Joseph is Jesus's (biological) father. It's also possible that they wanted to introduce elements of pagan legends, though harmless ones in this case (unless you take it to the extreme of worshiping Mary).
post.title: What do you think of the virgin birth story?

body:
The front of the brain is where cognitive skills are, where brilliant people specialize. The back of the brain controls motor skills and spatial awareness.

Be honest, which brain looks more optimized for the former to you?

![](https://i.imgur.com/xiWRkq9.jpg)

Girls just act dumb and immature because *they're allowed to* and even encouraged to do so. Boys would face SERIOUS consequences for doing the same things. This is a primal instinct which lines up with the order of nature where the female is inherently precious for having a scare function, and the males are the expendable sperm producers and slaves whose only value is in what they do. Males are also designed to hunt with sheer force and physical power while females do so with cunning tricks and more brain power.

post.body:
Currently most successful people are men. So are the least. The current consensus is that the average intelligence for both sexes is the same, but males are more variable than females.

I call that bull. I think the entire intelligence curve for females is simply shifted to the right of males. In every single hard class at high school and university level, there are far more boys but the handful of girls are always at the top of the class, easily solving problems that stump the hell out of the boys. It's the same at any non-blue-collar workplace, there are more male employees overall but the female minority does a better job, is more productive, and comes up with more ideas. All across the board it's been shown that girls are substantially better learners than boys, and have sharper and more active minds. Girls also have a *significant* advantage in the arts, languages, music, humanities, even just simple functions like memory and emotion. While still having a slight advantage even in "male" subjects like STEM. Pretty much anything involving designing or creating, even simple outside the box thinking, females are naturally going to be way better. Males commit suicide 3.5x more despite supposedly having less depression (I suspect it's actually because depression is biologically hardwired into males so is rarely taken seriously for them, in fact "whining" about it is usually punished).

It's not just stereotypes and observational evidence though. Brain scans back this up too. Female brains are typically a bit smaller, but so was Einstein's. Female brains have denser neurons that more than make up for it, and their hippocampus and cortices are all larger and wired much more efficiently than in males, which correlates to higher cognitive ability. Not only that, but it's been shown that males pretty much exclusively use the left side of their brain (logical, stoic, rational, logical, and blunt) while females are capable of using both sides. This is why men are usually so uncreative, unemotional (except for anger), unartistic, unsympathetic, and lack even the most basic intuition and feeling. Pretty much the only thing males excel at in the mental realm is spatial awareness. And even then, only in the real physical world; females are still usually superior at crafting, designing, and drawing shapes and 3d perspectives. This also makes biological sense. Think back to ancient times, when male was the more "disposable" sex that was constantly sent into risky and brutal situations, fighting, mating, and laboring, while the females engaged more in homemaking, childrearing, and organizing society. You don't need much of a brain to do the former, and with so many resources devoted to it, males lose a lot of other capabilities. Men are pretty much smarter as children than they are as adults! Why do you think Homer Simpson is so familiar? This explains some other things too, like why men die younger and feel pain worse despite having to endure more painful situations.

So why are some men still more successful and have higher IQs? My theory is societal expectations. From the moment they enter school, boys MUST succeed, do what they're told, and do it *extremely* well or there will be consequences. Girls are usually given a lot more slack. Boys are expected to have careers and become independent, whereas girls are allowed to leech off of them their whole lives, and allowed to run to someone else crying for help with every tiny thing that doesn't go their way. So what happens is that only the ambitious girls end up cultivating their skills. And when they do, the results are amazing. But obviously the people who actually *want* to pursue things instead of being lazy are the minority of the population. If you pick out 10 geniuses, chances are 9 of them will be boys but the one girl will be smarter than half of them combined. She will usually be multi-talented, easy to work with, have a lot of ideas, well-rounded and brilliant. Top IQs reflect this, in which they are almost all males but the #1 spot goes to a female. If most females would put down the makeup and snapchat and become interested in something actually productive like the males are made to do, I think their intelligence would improve quite drastically. But we instead encourage that hyper "girly" behavior which doesn't accomplish anything except make it even harder for the sexes to understand each other than it already would be. Boys are far too neglected and girls are way too coddled. It doesn't make any sense to have lower expectations for the ones with higher potential. I think there needs to be a serious shift in raising girls to become productive persons rather than docile crybabies. They'd be happier and have more fun that way too.

body:
Your false dichotomy is that you seem to think I'm a hostile atheist trying to stir up doubt because I questioned the virgin birth. In actuality, I figured it out when I saw that the prophecy of a virgin was a mistranslation, which made me confused because that's what Matthew and Luke use to show it was predicted. However, I would expect at least the former to be familiar with the Hebrew version, so that doesn't sound like a mistake they would make. In addition, unless Mary was also from the Davidic line, the virgin birth breaks the prophecy of a messiah being a descendant of David. Then I realized that the genealogies don't make any sense if Mary was a virgin, because they are both for Joseph. Then I remembered that there are variants in Matthew that say "Joseph begat Jesus" in the oldest manuscripts, and that "Jesus's father" was often replaced with Joseph. Then I looked for textual clues in Luke, and saw that the 3rd chapter of Luke looks like the beginning of a story, and reintroduces multiple things which had already been in the first two chapters, which were about the virgin birth (which is also not consistent with the version found in Matthew). Then I found that many scholars noticed the same thing. Doing some more research, I found out that early church fathers complained quite a bit about versions of Matthew and Luke which did not contain the virgin birth story, including the supposed Hebrew edition of Matthew. The case against the virgin birth is just **really** strong. Like I said, it appears that the church fathers, while corrupting the text, as you also mentioned in [this post](https://ruqqus.com/+JesusChrist/post/57t2/hell-sheol-hades-tartarus), added the story either because of a personal agenda or because of the mistranslation in the LXX which they sought to "prove" correct.

I'm curious what you heard about the genealogies.

body:
> Yes i was mistaken, my apologies. I remember hearing the genealogies thing explained in a way that makes sense but i guess i forgot what it actually was.

You are probably referring to the theory that "Joseph" in one of the versions (I think it was "to whom the virgin Mary was *engaged*" in Matthew) is Mary's father, because the word used in the Peshitta can mean that. However this has been debunked, that word cannot mean father. Furthermore, the Greek version is the original. While there is good reason to believe that all the gospels except John made use of a common source document in written in Aramaic, this has been lost for a long, long time, and the Peshitta is clearly a translation from the Greek.

I'm not sure how being suspicious of the virgin birth story would stir up doubt. Removing it resolves several inconsistencies and makes the NT line up with the original messianic prophecies.

Nowhere else do any of the writers show any indication of knowing about a virgin birth, including in the rest of Matthew and Luke. Additionally, some of the oldest manuscripts of Matthew read "Joseph begat Jesus" and many current references to Joseph are "Jesus's father" in the oldest manuscripts. The genealogy in Matthew makes no sense if Mary conceived as a virgin, as it shows Joseph's line of descent, not Mary's, and the whole point is to show how Jesus came from the Davidic line. I have a theory however about why this story was added: the faithless church fathers, instead of believing because it is self-evident, either newly interpreted Isaiah 7:14 as messianic, or it was actually put there by Matthew, but the church fathers, due to a mistranslation in the LXX, thought it meant virgin when it was actually young woman (the same word is used for both). Either way, they lacked faith and only cared about creating a religious system to control people, and authored this story to "prove" it right. Ironically, the original Hebrew prophecy is only correct if Joseph is Jesus's (biological) father. It's also possible that they wanted to introduce elements of pagan legends, though harmless ones in this case (unless you take it to the extreme of worshiping Mary).

body:
They are both for Joseph. There is never a genealogy for Mary, and if she conceived as a virgin then listing Joseph's at all is just a waste of time.

https://biblehub.com/matthew/1-16.htm

https://biblehub.com/luke/3-23.htm

The one in Luke is likely a later addition as it interrupts the story and early church fathers mentioned that it was missing from most copies that deviated from the church's official text (which was probably the most extensively edited). This would explain why it's at odds with Matthew's, especially if there is a racial or familial agenda behind it, which was quite common in ancient times when your ancestors defined you more than you. But it could just as easily be a mistake or conflicting records.

body:
By "most people" I assume you mean most people attending Authorized King James 1611 Only churches, because no one outside of those circles actually believes later copies are more reliable. The arguments that the older texts in our possession are erratic and corrupted make sense theoretically, but that doesn't mean it is the case, only that it *could* be. But we can be certain it is not so because:

* All quotes from early church fathers conform with the older texts; not a single one is aware of the later Byzantine text type

* All early translations conform to the earlier texts

* Internal evidence is clear that the later readings are the edited versions; they tend to smooth out the sentences and make it sound more natural, and sometimes insert later theology into the text. A scribe would want to make the text look better, not worse.

In the end I feel like insisting on the virgin birth just breaks the original messianic prophecy which says young woman, not virgin, as a translation error in the Septuagint implies. And the story could then be used to claim that Jesus can't be the messiah because he wasn't actually descended from David, as the genealogy shows Joseph's line of descent, not Mary's.

The arguments that the older texts in our possession are erratic and corrupted make sense theoretically, but that doesn't mean it is the case, only that it could be. But we can be certain it is not so because:

  • All quotes from early church fathers conform with the older texts; not a single one is aware of the later Byzantine text type

  • All early translations conform to the earlier texts

  • Internal evidence is clear that the later readings are the edited versions; they tend to smooth out the sentences and make it sound more natural, and sometimes insert later theology into the text. A scribe would want to make the text look better, not worse.

In the end I feel like insisting on the virgin birth just breaks the original messianic prophecy which says young woman, not virgin, as a translation error in the Septuagint implies. And the story could then be used to claim that Jesus can't be the messiah because he wasn't actually descended from David, as the genealogy shows Joseph's line of descent, not Mary's.

So naturally, both males and females are designed with the benefit of the female in mind, never the male. This is why females are so coddled and protected, and males hate themselves and revere them. Because females hold what's valuable and scare, and so everything biological is designed around them. The male's only value is in what he can do for the female, while hers in inherent and unconditional.

Even under the oppression of men, society has always operated this way at a basic level. Husbands always went to work while their wives enjoyed the fruits of their labor. Women and children have always been first. A girl throwing a tantrum has always been valid while a boy doing the exact same thing has always been a spoiled brat. At a primal level, people are simply more empathetic towards females and not so much with males: because our brains see girls as cute and innocent and boys as lazy violent ugly perverts. It's just an unintended consequence of reproductive design.

body:
The differences on those graphs are so tiny as to mean barely anything at all. Considering that boys are forced to work strenuously while the girls are coddled and tend to neglect their brain cells, it's actually pretty good evidence that the girls are smarter because they *still* match the boys in spite of this.

You can see clearly that female brains are designed for thinking whereas male brains are optimized more for physical skills (blue=male, orange=female): https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/bPhYyqHPN6axRnn2F8emKR.jpg

The structure isn't even comparable and it's obvious that the female is more invested in conscious and cognitive areas of the brain while the males pay more attention to the cerebellum and motor skills. In males the two hemispheres can't even work together and they have FAR less attention devoted to mental function on either side! Considering the historical roles of each sex there's no reason to be surprised at this finding unless you just want to insist that female=bad-and-only-exists-to-be-fucked.

Also guess which chromosomes the world record IQ holder has?

body:
Not all behavior is biological, but our urges and instincts most definitely are, and those are the biggest influences on our behavior.

And I never said it's not a tragedy when a man dies, if they're someone close to you. However in the case where you don't know the person, experiments have proven that if a female is in trouble everyone will react and do whatever they can, whereas if a male is in distress he'll just be ignored or laughed at. Think about it, a crying girl needs cared for but a boy doing the same is just a whiny spoiled brat. It's called the "women are wonderful" effect, we're hardwired to be very empathetic towards females because they're so valuable, but the same is not true for the expendable males. You could say that this reduces the female's value down to her uterus, however this is true for both sexes as males are also reduced to sperm donors. What's important are the *side effects* of sexual function on every other aspect of life, and it seems the male ones are much more detrimental to personal life. This is because for us males, the more valuable organ lies within the other sex, and not ourselves, therefore we are designed to benefit the female, and so is she; neither sex is designed with the welfare of the male in mind, as there's always more males; the female is the important one. You may object and say this is only about sex and doesn't matter elsewhere, but since nearly every part of biology is optimized for sexual reproduction, this is a HUGE deal. It's not like there's some kind of conspiracy to make males miserable, it's just an unintended consequence of how nature works. I will not deny that there are miserable females, they may even make up the majority; however they at least have the *chance* to be happy, while males are pretty much hardwired to be miserable even if they're the luckiest person in history.

When they die it's *still* a 'tragedy', seen as a great loss so long as the man was cared for (family, friends, colleagues etc... (and not totally horrible, like a child molester). People weep for both genders. Always have, and always will. 

And I surely didn't mean to make it sound like we take something biological, say oak, and then make it a social norm that everyone who indulges in that culture likes that particular tree. That is at least the (incorrect assumption) thing you seem to have taken out of everything I relayed to you. 

Yes surely, it is based on biological differences at large, because that is what makes our behaviour; HOWEVER, why would we have a patriarchy instead of a matriarchy like orcas do? They're the least bit if not more intelligent than humans, so why don't we do like them? Our social norms were based on our very 'animalistic' nature back in the day, that was based on our biology. Nowadays however, it's based on being sedentary and bringing home those sweets sweet shekels. Computers aren't biology, they're not something we have evolved to have or even use, but they're still a social norm today.

parent.body:
Not because they are protected by society. Its largely biology at play, which news flash, has little to no effect on our social norms.

"Women have two copies of the X chromosome in every cell, whereas men have one X and one Y chromosome. With women, if one of the genes on the X chromosome becomes faulty, they have a healthy ‚Äòbackup‚Äô copy. Men, on the other hand, have to make do with any faulty genes on their single X chromosome, which can put them at a greater risk of disease.

From the moment they are a ball of cells, males are more vulnerable than females, with male babies at a 20 per cent greater risk of dying in the womb. But according to ageing expert Prof David Gems at University College London, mortality in men soars once puberty hits. Some of this is due to men‚Äôs more risky behaviour, but studies suggest that long-term problems are caused by the physical changes in the body created by the hormone testosterone.

A 2012 study of records from pre-19th-Century Korea showed that eunuchs who were castrated as boys before the testosterone surge of puberty, lived 14 to 19 years longer than their contemporaries.

With the life expectancy differences so tied up with hormones and genetics, it seems unlikely that men will ever close the gap entirely. But the good news is that not all of our ageing is predetermined. The Russian gap between the sexes, for instance, is thought to be due to the culture of heavy drinking and smoking. As cultures can change, it‚Äôs possible for both sexes to live healthier lives with the genetic hand they are dealt. Meanwhile, advances in our treatment of diseases should help us to close the gap even further."

"[...] the gender differential in life expectancy from birth is about 6.5 years greater for women in the U.S., 5.3 years in the UK, 12 years in Russia, and about 6 months in India. This societal diversity implies that social factors have an influence on male and female longevity. While women have a biological advantage, historically certain living conditions and social customs tended to negate this benefit. For example, iron deficiency anemia due to female blood loss contributed in the past to excess female mortality. Social differences between men and women and the challenges of motherhood have further compromised women‚Äôs biological advantage.

Female hormones, particularly estrogen, and the resiliency of the female body to accommodate pregnancy and breast-feeding are also thought to promote longevity. Estrogens have beneficial effects on lipids in the blood and seem to protect a woman from premature heart disease.

Male behaviors tend to be riskier, and more men are exposed to hazards in the workplace. Men experience more motor vehicle accidents and have higher rates of alcoholism and smoking. In addition, males tend to drive more aggressively than females, and men on average smoke more cigarettes and drink more alcohol than women. These excess risks in men tend to increase the likelihood of heart disease and malignancy.

The ways the genders relate to their bodies is another potential factor explaining male and female longevity differences. Women tend to be more health conscious and attend to their bodies, seeking preventive health care and practicing healthier lifestyles compared to men. Men relate to their bodies with strength and power and expose them to risks from early ages.

Another way to approach the longevity differential between women and men is to look at the causes of death across the life span. Graphs of mortality ratios by gender show excess male mortality by violence that peaks at 4:1 around age 30. Gender-specific mortality rates for the top 10 causes of death shows excess male-to-female ratio for all conditions except diabetes mellitus, for which the risk is identical. Whether this gender gap relates to biological differences or lifestyle choices such as cigarette smoking is a matter of debate. Perhaps diabetes in women somehow reduces the gender-specific advantage enjoyed by women for other diseases.

Nonetheless, the consequences of atherosclerosis clearly affect the longevity differential between men and women. Roughly speaking, if all atherosclerotic causes of death were immediately eliminated, the gender mortality gap would be cut in half."

**And I have to throw this in here because KEK!!**: "Of course, other social factors could also have an influence on gender longevity. The perception of temperature sometimes generates marital tensions. The topic came up at a medical conference on aging, and after the discussion, an elderly man told me, ‚ÄúIt is perfectly clear why women outlive men: Their wives freeze them to death.‚Äù"
